article:
John and I were on our way to St. Louis, Missouri, for a quick trip of job interviews. His job   _  him to
move, and, even  _  we weren't engaged yet, he
asked me to move with him.
We had discussed getting married and already looked at   _  . John even asked my parents  _  their
blessing. Everything was set, though we weren't officially engaged. As we  boarded  our plane, we found our seats and we sat waiting for departure. I
noticed one of the  _  leave the plane. When he
returned we were ready for the plane to  take off  . The
captain made the usual  _  : altitude , weather, arrival time, my name.
What? Did I just hear my name? My heart started   _  heavily. Did I do something
  _  ? Even with all of these thoughts racing through
my mind, I somehow  heard every word:
" Attention please. Lynette, John Helms would like to know   _  you would spend the rest of your life with
him. If you accept, please  _  the 'call' button  _  the attendants  will be with you shortly."
My eyes filled with tears. When John opened a small ring box and smiled, I   _  . "Yes." He placed the ring on my
hand and we embraced  as the other passengers   _  . I was  _  to push the call button. But I couldn't reach it with my seatbelt  still fastened, so John gladly pressed it for me. All three attendants   _  ,
one carrying a bottle of champagne .
As we landed and approached out gate, the   _  again included us in his announcements. "Congratulations to the newly
engaged couple. On behalf of  the entire
crew , let me wish you the best." John thanked the flight attendants for helping
with his plan. It was then  _  we learned that
the pilot had left the plane earlier to get the bottle of  _  for us!
